verses.roman:
nityānanda-gosāñi prabhura āveśa jānila
gaṅgā-jala-pātra āni' sammukhe dharila

synonyms: nityānanda-gosāñi—Lord Nityānanda Prabhu; prabhura—of the Lord; āveśa—ecstasy; jānila—could understand; gaṅgā-jala—Ganges water; pātra—pot; āni'-bringing; sammukhe—in front; dharila—placed it.
translation: Nityānanda Prabhu Gosāñi, understanding the ecstatic mood of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, brought a pot of Ganges water as a token and put it before Him.
